FuncDef:
The option33 route command configures routes from the network segment where an IP address pool resides to the destination network segment.
The undo option33 route command deletes the configured routes.
By default, no routes are configured from the network segment where an IP address pool resides to the destination network segment.

ParaDef.Info:
Destination IP address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Gateway's IP address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Examples: Info: It's successful to create an IP address pool
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The option33 route command allows a user to obtain both an IP address and a route to the destination network segment.
Configuration Impact
Users will send packets along specified routes.
Precautions
This command is supported only on the admin VS.
A maximum of eight routes can be configured from the network segment where an IP address pool resides to the destination network segment.
